# ğŸ’¡ Fleeting Notes / é—ªå¿µç¬”è®°

## Definition

Fleeting notes are quick, temporary captures of ideas, thoughts, or observations. They are the first step in the [[Zettelkasten]] knowledge management workflow.

## Purpose

- **Quick capture**: Capture ideas immediately before they're forgotten
- **Temporary storage**: Hold information until it can be processed
- **Low friction**: Minimal formatting, just get the idea down

## PARA Workflow Integration

```mermaid
flowchart LR
    A[Idea/Thought] --> B[InBox Capture]
    B --> C{Process?}
    C -->|Yes| D[Convert to Permanent Note]
    C -->|No| E[Archive/Delete]
    D --> F[Link to Related Notes]
```

1. **Capture** in `0 Personals/ğŸ“¥ 00_InBox/`
2. **Process** using `/para-æ•´ç†æ”¶é›†`
3. **Convert** to permanent notes or [[ğŸ’¡ literature notes]]
4. **Delete** fleeting notes after processing

## Best Practices

### âœ… Do

- Capture ideas immediately with minimal formatting
- Use simple, clear language
- Include context/source if important
- Process regularly (daily/weekly)

### âŒ Don't

- Spend time organizing while capturing
- Overthink or over-edit fleeting notes
- Keep unprocessed notes too long
- Lose the original spark while polishing

## Transformation Process

| Step | Action | Result |
|------|--------|--------|
| 1 | Review fleeting notes | Identify valuable ideas |
| 2 | Extract core concepts | Create [[ğŸ’¡ literature notes]] or [[ğŸ’¡ permanent notes]] |
| 3 | Add connections | Link to existing notes |
| 4 | Discard fleeting note | Original is no longer needed |

## Related Concepts

- [[Zettelkasten]] - Overall system
- [[ğŸ’¡ literature notes]] - From external sources
- [[ğŸ’¡ permanent notes]] - Refined atomic ideas
- [[PARA]] - Organization system

## Examples

> [!example] Good Fleeting Note
> "The idea that fleeting notes should be quick captures - just get it down without formatting"

> [!example] Bad Fleeting Note
> (A perfectly formatted note with multiple sections, tags, and wikilinks - this should have been a permanent note directly)

## Tools & Techniques

- **Voice capture**: Use voice-to-text for quick capture
- **Mobile apps**: Capture on the go
- **Browser extensions**: Capture from web
- **Quick shortcuts**: Keyboard shortcuts for instant capture

---

> [!quote] "The best note is the one you actually capture." - Unknown Zettelkasten practitioner

# ğŸ’¡ Fleeting Notes / é—ªå¿µç¬”è®°

## Definition

Fleeting notes are quick, temporary captures of ideas, thoughts, or observations. They are the first step in the [[Zettelkasten]] knowledge management workflow.

## Purpose

- **Quick capture**: Capture ideas immediately before they're forgotten
- **Temporary storage**: Hold information until it can be processed
- **Low friction**: Minimal formatting, just get the idea down

## PARA Workflow Integration

```mermaid
flowchart LR
    A[Idea/Thought] --> B[InBox Capture]
    B --> C{Process?}
    C -->|Yes| D[Convert to Permanent Note]
    C -->|No| E[Archive/Delete]
    D --> F[Link to Related Notes]
```

1. **Capture** in `0 Personals/ğŸ“¥ 00_InBox/`
2. **Process** using `/para-æ•´ç†æ”¶é›†`
3. **Convert** to permanent notes or [[ğŸ’¡ literature notes]]
4. **Delete** fleeting notes after processing

## Best Practices

### âœ… Do

- Capture ideas immediately with minimal formatting
- Use simple, clear language
- Include context/source if important
- Process regularly (daily/weekly)

### âŒ Don't

- Spend time organizing while capturing
- Overthink or over-edit fleeting notes
- Keep unprocessed notes too long
- Lose the original spark while polishing

## Transformation Process

| Step | Action | Result |
|------|--------|--------|
| 1 | Review fleeting notes | Identify valuable ideas |
| 2 | Extract core concepts | Create [[ğŸ’¡ literature notes]] or [[ğŸ’¡ permanent notes]] |
| 3 | Add connections | Link to existing notes |
| 4 | Discard fleeting note | Original is no longer needed |

## Related Concepts

- [[Zettelkasten]] - Overall system
- [[ğŸ’¡ literature notes]] - From external sources
- [[ğŸ’¡ permanent notes]] - Refined atomic ideas
- [[PARA]] - Organization system

## Examples

> [!example] Good Fleeting Note
> "The idea that fleeting notes should be quick captures - just get it down without formatting"

> [!example] Bad Fleeting Note
> (A perfectly formatted note with multiple sections, tags, and wikilinks - this should have been a permanent note directly)

## Tools & Techniques

- **Voice capture**: Use voice-to-text for quick capture
- **Mobile apps**: Capture on the go
- **Browser extensions**: Capture from web
- **Quick shortcuts**: Keyboard shortcuts for instant capture

---

> [!quote] "The best note is the one you actually capture." - Unknown Zettelkasten practitioner

## Definition

Fleeting notes are quick, temporary captures of ideas, thoughts, or observations. They are the first step in the [[Zettelkasten]] knowledge management workflow.

## Purpose

- **Quick capture**: Capture ideas immediately before they're forgotten
- **Temporary storage**: Hold information until it can be processed
- **Low friction**: Minimal formatting, just get the idea down

## PARA Workflow Integration

```mermaid
flowchart LR
    A[Idea/Thought] --> B[InBox Capture]
    B --> C{Process?}

    C -->|No| E[Archive/Delete]
    D --> F[Link to Related Notes]
```

4. **Delete** fleeting notes after processing

- Capture ideas immediately with minimal formatting
- Use simple, clear language
- Include context/source if important
- Process regularly (daily/weekly)

### âŒ Don't

- Spend time organizing while capturing
- Overthink or over-edit fleeting notes
- Keep unprocessed notes too long
- Lose the original spark while polishing

## Definition

Fleeting notes are quick, temporary captures of ideas, thoughts, or observations. They are the first step in the [[Zettelkasten]] knowledge management workflow.

## Purpose

- **Quick capture**: Capture ideas immediately before they're forgotten
- **Temporary storage**: Hold information until it can be processed
- **Low friction**: Minimal formatting, just get the idea down

## PARA Workflow Integration

```mermaid
flowchart LR
    A[Idea/Thought] --> B[InBox Capture]
    B --> C{Process?}
    C -->|Yes| D[Convert to Permanent Note]
    C -->|No| E[Archive/Delete]
    D --> F[Link to Related Notes]
```

1. **Capture** in `0 Personals/ğŸ“¥ 00_InBox/`
2. **Process** using `/para-æ•´ç†æ”¶é›†`
3. **Convert** to permanent notes or [[ğŸ’¡ literature notes]]
4. **Delete** fleeting notes after processing

## Best Practices

### âœ… Do

- Capture ideas immediately with minimal formatting
- Use simple, clear language
- Include context/source if important
- Process regularly (daily/weekly)

### âŒ Don't

- Spend time organizing while capturing
- Overthink or over-edit fleeting notes
- Keep unprocessed notes too long
- Lose the original spark while polishing

## Transformation Process

| Step | Action | Result |
|------|--------|--------|
| 1 | Review fleeting notes | Identify valuable ideas |
| 2 | Extract core concepts | Create [[ğŸ’¡ literature notes]] or [[ğŸ’¡ permanent notes]] |
| 3 | Add connections | Link to existing notes |
| 4 | Discard fleeting note | Original is no longer needed |

## Definition

Fleeting notes are quick, temporary captures of ideas, thoughts, or observations. They are the first step in the [[Zettelkasten]] knowledge management workflow.

## Purpose

- **Quick capture**: Capture ideas immediately before they're forgotten
- **Temporary storage**: Hold information until it can be processed
- **Low friction**: Minimal formatting, just get the idea down

## PARA Workflow Integration

```mermaid
flowchart LR
    A[Idea/Thought] --> B[InBox Capture]
    B --> C{Process?}
    C -->|Yes| D[Convert to Permanent Note]
    C -->|No| E[Archive/Delete]
    D --> F[Link to Related Notes]
```

1. **Capture** in `0 Personals/ğŸ“¥ 00_InBox/`
2. **Process** using `/para-æ•´ç†æ”¶é›†`
3. **Convert** to permanent notes or [[ğŸ’¡ literature notes]]
4. **Delete** fleeting notes after processing

## Best Practices

### âœ… Do

- Capture ideas immediately with minimal formatting
- Use simple, clear language
- Include context/source if important
- Process regularly (daily/weekly)

### âŒ Don't

- Spend time organizing while capturing
- Overthink or over-edit fleeting notes
- Keep unprocessed notes too long
- Lose the original spark while polishing

## Transformation Process

| Step | Action | Result |
|------|--------|--------|
| 1 | Review fleeting notes | Identify valuable ideas |
| 2 | Extract core concepts | Create [[ğŸ’¡ literature notes]] or [[ğŸ’¡ permanent notes]] |
| 3 | Add connections | Link to existing notes |
| 4 | Discard fleeting note | Original is no longer needed |

# ğŸ’¡ Fleeting Notes / é–ƒå¿µç­†è¨˜

> [!info] ğŸ“Š Dashboard Overview
> **ç¸½ç­†è¨˜æ•¸**: 12 | **æœ€å¾Œæ›´æ–°**: 2026-01-20 | **ä½ç½®**: [[5 Zettels/ğŸ’¡ fleeting/]]

## Definition

Fleeting notes are quick, temporary captures of ideas, thoughts, or observations. They are the first step in the [[Zettelkasten]] knowledge management workflow.

## Purpose

- **Quick capture**: Capture ideas immediately before they're forgotten
- **Temporary storage**: Hold information until it can be processed
- **Low friction**: Minimal formatting, just get the idea down

## PARA Workflow Integration

```mermaid
flowchart LR
    A[Idea/Thought] --> B[InBox Capture]
    B --> C{Process?}
    C -->|Yes| D[Convert to Permanent Note]
    C -->|No| E[Archive/Delete]
    D --> F[Link to Related Notes]
```

1. **Capture** in `0 Personals/ğŸ“¥ 00_InBox/`
2. **Process** using `/para-æ•´ç†æ”¶é›†`
3. **Convert** to permanent notes or [[ğŸ’¡ literature notes]]
4. **Delete** fleeting notes after processing

## Best Practices

### âœ… Do

- Capture ideas immediately with minimal formatting
- Use simple, clear language
- Include context/source if important
- Process regularly (daily/weekly)

### âŒ Don't

- Spend time organizing while capturing
- Overthink or over-edit fleeting notes
- Keep unprocessed notes too long
- Lose the original spark while polishing

## Transformation Process

| Step | Action | Result |
|------|--------|--------|
| 1 | Review fleeting notes | Identify valuable ideas |
| 2 | Extract core concepts | Create [[ğŸ’¡ literature notes]] or [[ğŸ’¡ permanent notes]] |
| 3 | Add connections | Link to existing notes |
| 4 | Discard fleeting note | Original is no longer needed |

```dataview
  file.link AS "Topic",
  rows.file.link AS "Notes"
FROM "5 Zettels/ğŸ’¡ fleeting"

GROUP BY split(file.name, "-")[0]
SORT ASC
```

> Set aside 10-15 minutes at the end of each day to review and process your fleeting notes. This prevents backlog and ensures no valuable ideas are lost.

    55â†’- Process regularly (daily/weekly)
    56â†’
    57â†’### âŒ Don't
    58â†’
    59â†’- Spend time organizing while capturing
    60â†’- Overthink or over-edit fleeting notes
    61â†’- Keep unprocessed notes too long
    62â†’- Lose the original spark while polishing
    63â†’
    64â†’## Transformation Process
    65â†’
    66â†’| Step | Action | Result |
    67â†’|------|--------|--------|
    68â†’| 1 | Review fleeting notes | Identify valuable ideas |
    69â†’| 2 | Extract core concepts | Create [[ğŸ’¡ literature notes]] or [[ğŸ’¡ permanent notes]] |
    70â†’| 3 | Add connections | Link to existing notes |
    71â†’| 4 | Discard fleeting note | Original is no longer needed |
    72â†’
    73â†’## ğŸ“Š Note Statistics
    74â†’
    75â†’```dataview
    76â†’TABLE WITHOUT ID
    77â†’  file.link AS "Topic",
    78â†’  rows.file.link AS "Notes"
    79â†’FROM "5 Zettels/ğŸ’¡ fleeting"
    80â†’WHERE file.name != "ğŸ’¡ fleeting.md"
    81â†’FLATTEN file.name
    82â†’GROUP BY split(file.name, "-")[0]
    83â†’SORT ASC

    85â†’
    86â†’### Notes by Category

    90â†’| å€‹äººæˆé•· | æˆé•·è¿½è¹¤, è‡ªæˆ‘ç®¡ç†, ç¿’æ…£ | 3 |
    91â†’| å·¥ä½œå­¸ç¿’ | å·¥ä½œ, å­¸ç¿’, æ·±åº¦å·¥ä½œ, å°ˆæ³¨åŠ›, çŸ¥è­˜ç®¡ç† | 5 |
    92â†’| ç”Ÿæ´»ç®¡ç† | æ—¥è¨˜, åæ€, æ™‚é–“ç®¡ç† | 3 |

    94â†’| **Total** | **12** | - |

    96â†’---
    97â†’
    98â†’## ğŸ“‹ Management Actions
    99â†’
   100â†’> [!todo]- Quick Actions
   101â†’> - [ ] Review all fleeting notes weekly
   102â†’> - [ ] Convert valuable ideas to permanent notes
   103â†’> - [ ] Archive processed notes
   104â†’> - [ ] Clean up outdated notes
   105â†’
   106â†’## ğŸ” Search & Filter
   107â†’

   124â†’## Related Concepts

   128â†’- [[ğŸ’¡ permanent notes]] - Refined atomic ideas
   129â†’- [[PARA]] - Organization system
   130â†’- [[é–ƒå¿µç­†è¨˜å·¥ä½œæµ]] - Complete workflow guide
   131â†’
   132â†’## Examples
   133â†’
   134â†’> [!example] Good Fleeting Note
   135â†’> "The idea that fleeting notes should be quick captures - just get it down without formatting"
   136â†’
   137â†’> [!example] Bad Fleeting Note
   138â†’> (A perfectly formatted note with multiple sections, tags, and wikilinks - this should have been a permanent note directly)
   139â†’

   152â†’## Tools & Techniques
   153â†’
   154â†’- **Voice capture**: Use voice-to-text for quick capture
   155â†’- **Mobile apps**: Capture on the go
   156â†’- **Browser extensions**: Capture from web

   161â†’> [!quote] "The best note is the one you actually capture." - Unknown Zettelkasten practitioner
   162â†’
   163â†’> [!tip] ğŸ’¡ Pro Tip
   164â†’> Set aside 10-15 minutes at the end of each day to review and process your fleeting notes. This prevents backlog and ensures no valuable ideas are lost.

# ğŸ’¡ Fleeting Notes / é–ƒå¿µç­†è¨˜

> [!info] ğŸ“Š Dashboard Overview
> **ç¸½ç­†è¨˜æ•¸**: 12 | **æœ€å¾Œæ›´æ–°**: 2026-01-20 | **ä½ç½®**: [[5 Zettels/ğŸ’¡ fleeting/]]

## Definition

Fleeting notes are quick, temporary captures of ideas, thoughts, or observations. They are the first step in the [[Zettelkasten]] knowledge management workflow.

## Purpose

- **Quick capture**: Capture ideas immediately before they're forgotten
- **Temporary storage**: Hold information until it can be processed
- **Low friction**: Minimal formatting, just get the idea down

## PARA Workflow Integration

```mermaid
flowchart LR
    A[Idea/Thought] --> B[InBox Capture]
    B --> C{Process?}
    C -->|Yes| D[Convert to Permanent Note]
    C -->|No| E[Archive/Delete]
    D --> F[Link to Related Notes]
```

1. **Capture** in `0 Personals/ğŸ“¥ 00_InBox/`
2. **Process** using `/para-æ•´ç†æ”¶é›†`
3. **Convert** to permanent notes or [[ğŸ’¡ literature notes]]
4. **Delete** fleeting notes after processing

## Best Practices

### âœ… Do

- Capture ideas immediately with minimal formatting
- Use simple, clear language
- Include context/source if important
- Process regularly (daily/weekly)

### âŒ Don't

- Spend time organizing while capturing
- Overthink or over-edit fleeting notes
- Keep unprocessed notes too long
- Lose the original spark while polishing

## Transformation Process

| Step | Action | Result |
|------|--------|--------|
| 1 | Review fleeting notes | Identify valuable ideas |
| 2 | Extract core concepts | Create [[ğŸ’¡ literature notes]] or [[ğŸ’¡ permanent notes]] |
| 3 | Add connections | Link to existing notes |
| 4 | Discard fleeting note | Original is no longer needed |


| ç”Ÿæ´»ç®¡ç† | æ—¥è¨˜, åæ€, æ™‚é–“ç®¡ç† | 3 |
| è²¡å‹™ç®¡ç† | è²¡å‹™ | 1 |
| **Total** | **12** | - |

> - [ ] Review all fleeting notes weekly

> [!example] Bad Fleeting Note

## Tools & Techniques

- **Voice capture**: Use voice-to-text for quick capture
- **Mobile apps**: Capture on the go
- **Browser extensions**: Capture from web
- **Quick shortcuts**: Keyboard shortcuts for instant capture
